p: Based on the farmers who provided information about the occurrence of MLN between 2012 and 2015, MLN was most prevalent in 2014. The high 2014 MLN prevalence was associated with complete maize yield loss for 88% of the interviewed farmers across the three study regions ( Table 3). During assessment in farmersâ€™ fields, typical symptoms of MLN were observed. Symptoms included severe mosaic symptoms, leaf margin necrosis ( Figure 3a,c), and mild symptoms ( Figure 3b). In Mandaka Mnono-Kilimanjaro, maize fields were found to be highly infested by thrips, the major vector of MCMV [ 25, 26]. Aphids and thrips were also observed in other surveyed areas.
